title: Calories in Slices of Bacon
meta_description: Discover calories in slices of bacon, including macros, sodium, fat details per slice, totals for 2 slices, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Thin-sliced pork bacon, pan-fried until crisp, excess fat drained; ~8 g per slice uncooked weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, slice thickness, curing method, and cooking (fried, baked, or microwaved). Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: Two slices of cooked bacon provide about 86 kcal, 6 g protein, and 330 mg sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of bacon?
faqs.a: Approximately 43 kcal per cooked thin slice.

faqs.q: Is bacon high in fat or sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, one slice has 3.3 g fat (1.1 g saturated) and 192 mg sodium.

faqs.q: Calories in slices of bacon when baked?
faqs.a: Baking reduces fat slightly; about 35 kcal per slice versus 43 fried.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Pan-frying retains more fat than baking or microwaving, increasing calories.
